p: The results indicated that the n-hexane fraction (HF) of G. mollis leaf extracts significantly (p≤ 0.05) inhibited COX-1 (IC 50 =0.97±1.9 µg/mL) and COX-2 (IC 50 =1.13±0.2 µg/mL) better than the indomethacin reference compound (IC 50 =1.3±0.6 and 1.52±0.2 µg/mL) respectively ( Table 1). In particular, the inhibition of COX-2 is preferred because COX-1 has beneficial physiological functions in the gastric mucosa and on platelet aggregation. 3 There is little information on the anti-COX activity of n-hexane fraction of G. mollis, and this probably represents the first report. Furthermore, the presence of triterpenes in the n-hexane extracts of the roots was confirmed in our study and has been reported elsewhere. 16
